aws::graph::propositions: # Meteorological Information and Flight Plan for Accident Site
The accident site had Visual Meteorological Conditions (VMC).
The condition of light at the accident site was Day.
The observation facility was KLVN.
KLVN is at an elevation of 960 feet mean sea level.
The observation facility was 0 Nautical Miles from the accident site.
The observation time was 18:51 Local.
The observation facility was 10 degrees from the accident site.
The lowest cloud condition was Clear.
The visibility at the accident site was 10 miles.
There was no ceiling at the accident site.
The wind speed was 11 knots.
The wind had gusts of 18 knots.
No turbulence was experienced at the accident site.
The wind direction was 190 degrees.
The altimeter setting was 29.7 inches of mercury.
The temperature at the accident site was 27 degrees Celsius.
The dew point at the accident site was 21 degrees Celsius.
There was no obscuration at the accident site.
There was no precipitation at the accident site.
The departure point was Minneapolis, Minnesota (FCM).
No flight plan was filed.
The destination was Minneapolis, Minnesota (LVN).
The flight had Visual Flight Rules (VFR) clearance.
The departure time was 13:00 Local.
